title.rendered: Global signup now activated for teams in 360Player!

content.rendered:
[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.7.7″ _module_preset=”default” da_is_popup=”off” da_exit_intent=”off” da_has_close=”on” da_alt_close=”off” da_dark_close=”off” da_not_modal=”on” da_is_singular=”off” da_with_loader=”off” da_has_shadow=”on” da_disable_devices=”off|off|off”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.7.7″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_column _builder_version=”4.7.7″ _module_preset=”default” type=”4_4″][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.7.7″ _module_preset=”default” hover_enabled=”0″ sticky_enabled=”0″]

If you are a team that wants to get started with 360Player, but don’t have a local contact to reach out to, you can now get started by yourself automatically! 

The 360Player team has now enabled automatic onboarding of teams that purchases a team plan of 360Player. The team plan includes licenses for 30 users and has adapted prices for multiple currencies and markets.

By getting started with the team plan, a team can try the platform for free for 14 days.

“It is very important to us that we can deliver the service to anyone interested, regardless of where they are, and this is a start of our global offering” – says CPO Alexander Kraitsik.

If you want to get started with your team, click here.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
